_metadata.MDDescription:
Generally, most of the functionalities are using chat commands. Simply type the commands in the chat box (like how you would normally chat with teammates).
>Note: Remember to either use allies or all chat channel when try to use the commands. Public chat channels and Private Messages (PM) does not work.

Most commands have a short alias command, they both have identical functionality which let you to type less.

_metadata.libraryDescription: A unified Module Loader Lib that allows you to choose which module to load.
_metadata.overrideMarkdownContent: This module is for loading other modules. **DO NOT** modify this file in SC2Editor.

_metadata.libraryDescription: A Library with multiple utilities tools such as "Toggle Fog Of War", "Toggle UI", etc.

commands.description: Toggle Debug Mode by modifying the `libCore_gv_dEBUGDebuggingEnabled` variable)

examples.description: Toggle Debug Mode
Toggle Debug Mode

commands.description: Toggle Fog Of War. This can enable or disable full map vision.

examples.description: Toggle Full Map Vision
Toggle Full Map Vision

commands.description:
Toggle User Interface. This can hide or show all the UIs including HP bar, talents panel, floating combat text, abilities bar etc.

>Note: If the UI is off, all abilities will be disabled.

examples.description: Toggle In game UI
Toggle In game UI

commands.description: Clear all text messages, including chat and debug messages with an optional delay.

parameters.name: seconds
parameters.description: Defines the delay to clear text messages in seconds.

examples.description: Clear all texts instantly
Clear all texts after 5.4 seconds

commands.description:
Restart the map without needed to re-enter. This is extremely useful when you want to try the new modified XML files or galaxy scripts. 
 >Note: It will **NOT** reload or add mods from `Includes.xml` automatically. You will need to manually re-enter for mods to be added.

examples.description: Restart the game instantly
Restart the game instantly

commands.description: Start the game instantly (timer start, gate open, etc).

examples.description: Start the game instantly
Start the game instantly

commands.description: End the game instantly and kick all players from the game.

examples.description: End the game instantly
End the game instantly

commands.description:
Instantly declare a win for a team and end the game.
Generally left team is **Team 1** and right team is **Team 2**.

parameters.name: TeamID
parameters.description: Defines the team ID to win the game.

examples.description: Win the game for Team 1
Win the game for Team 2

commands.description:
Manually set the camera object. The parameter is the id of `<CCamera id="xxx">`.
>**WARNING**: Set a non existing camera will actually **crash** the game.

parameters.name: camera
parameters.description: Defines the camera object.

examples.description: Set the camera object to BlizzardAllStars (default game camera)
Set the camera object to Dlft (default SC2 camera)

commands.description: Reset the game camera to `BlizzardAllStars` (default game camera)

examples.description: Reset the game camera to BlizzardAllStars
Reset the game camera to BlizzardAllStars

commands.description:
Force to Run a Trigger created by `TriggerCreate()` with ignoring conditions and wait until finish. You can get these from the galaxy files. 

>Note: This command is mainly for debugging, most of the time it won't be useful.

parameters.name: TriggerName
parameters.description: Defines the trigger to be run

examples.description: Force to run the trigger "libUIUI_gt_InputBackslashKeyDown_Func", which will show up the debug menu.
Force to run the trigger "libSprt_gt_DEBUGHaveAITakeOverAI_Func", which will have an AI take over your unit.

commands.description:
Toggle Alliance Control + Multi-Selection, a shortcut re-implementation to QA Cheat Menu's `/ac` and `ts`.

This will enable/disable "Alliance Control" (control units from other players, including Enemy) and "Multi-Selection" (selecting multiple units like Vikings and Samuro).

examples.description: Toggle Alliance Control + Multi-Selection
Toggle Alliance Control + Multi-Selection

_metadata.libraryDescription: A library with commands related to selected units, such as kill, spawn, etc.

commands.description: Instantly kill all selected unit(s).

examples.description: Instantly kill all selected unit(s).
Instantly kill all selected unit(s).

commands.description: Toggle displaying units' id mode. Which will shows the unit's id on the screen with a left click.

examples.description: Toggle displaying units' id mode.
Toggle displaying units' id mode.

commands.description:
Spawn unit(s) at the centre of your camera location.
>Note: To control the summoned units, you will need to enable multi-selection from either the [`alliancecontrolteamselection`](#cmd-alliancecontrolteamselection) command or QA Cheat Menu (`ts`, also use `/ac` if the unit does not belong to you), which will behave like Vikings and Samuro with Illusion Master. 

>Note: If your hero is Samuro, it will have some weird behavior for multi selection due to Blizzard's implementation of Samuro.

parameters.name: UnitId
parameters.description: Define the unit to be spawned. You can get the id from <CUnit id="xxx"> in the game XML files.

parameters.name: Amount
parameters.description: Define the amount of unit(s) to be spawned

parameters.name: PlayerId
parameters.description: Define which player to own the unit that spawned.
parameters.defaultValue: The player id of whoever used this command.

parameters.name: Scale
parameters.description: Define scale of the unit(s) to be spawned. default size is 1.0

examples.description: Summon a tower structure to the player who used the command
Summon 3 Raynor Hero units for the player who used the command
Summon 2 Mal'Ganis Hero units for player 4
Summon 2 boss golems for player 1 with the unit scale to 0.5 (half the size)
Summon 10 Catapult Minions for player 5 with the unit scale to 2 (double the size)

commands.description:
Replace all selected units to the Target Unit.

>Note: Don't recommend using this command, as weird stuff will happen if you replaced to an non-existing unit or unit getting killed. If it happens, use the debug menu to respawn your hero for resetting.

parameters.name: TargetUnitId
parameters.description: Define the selected units to be replaced with. You can get the id from <CUnit id="xxx"> in the game XML files.

examples.description: Replace all selected unit(s) to Raynor Hero.
Replace all selected unit(s) to Catapult Minion.

commands.description:
Allow to modify a selected units' property, such as max health, regen, movement speed etc.


|Type|Galaxy file constant|
|-|-|
|0|c_unitPropLife|
|1|c_unitPropLifePercent|
|2|c_unitPropLifeMax|
|3|c_unitPropLifeRegen|
|4|c_unitPropEnergy|
|5|c_unitPropEnergyPercent|
|6|c_unitPropEnergyMax|
|7|c_unitPropEnergyRegen|
|8|c_unitPropShields|
|9|c_unitPropShieldsPercent|
|10|c_unitPropShieldsMax|
|11|c_unitPropShieldsRegen|
|12|c_unitPropKills|
|17|c_unitPropHeight|
|18|c_unitPropMovementSpeed|
|20|c_unitPropResources|
|21|c_unitPropRadius|
|22|c_unitPropXP|
|23|c_unitPropLevel|
|24|c_unitPropKillXP|
|28|c_unitPropBaseMovementSpeed|
|29|c_unitPropMovementSpeedCurrent|
|30|c_unitPropLifeExpectedPercent|

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Set the type of the property to be modified. Please refer to the table above.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to be set for the property type

examples.description: Set the selected units's Current HP to 1; MAX SPEEDZ TAZZZZDINGO
Set the selected unit's Max Energy for 10000 (usually means resource bar, such as mana, Tracer bullet, Chen's brew etc.)

commands.description: List all active behaviors for selected units.

examples.description: List all active behaviors for selected units
List all active behaviors for selected units

commands.description: Clear all active behaviors for selected units.

examples.description: Clear all active behaviors for selected units
Clear all active behaviors for selected units

commands.description: Add a behavior to selected unit(s). Which are generally from `<CBehavior*>`, such as `<CBehaviorBuff id="xxx">` or `<CBehaviorAbility id="xxx">`.

parameters.name: BehaviorId
parameters.description: Defines the behavior id to be added to selected units

examples.description: Add Medivh's Arcane Brilliance Ability to selected units
Make all selected units permanent Invulnerable

commands.description:
Remove a behavior from selected unit(s). Which are generally from `<CBehavior*>`, such as `<CBehaviorBuff id="xxx">` or `<CBehaviorAbility id="xxx">`.

> Tips: You can get active behaviors with the `getbehavior` command above.

parameters.name: BehaviorId
parameters.description: Defines the behavior id to be removed from selected units

examples.description: Remove Medivh's Arcane Brilliance Ability from selected units
No longer makes all selected units permanent Invulnerable

commands.description:
Count the number of a specific behavior from selected unit(s). Which are generally from `<CBehavior*>`, such as `<CBehaviorBuff id="xxx">` or `<CBehaviorAbility id="xxx">`.

> Tips: You can get active behaviors with the `getbehavior` command above.

parameters.name: BehaviorId
parameters.description: Defines the behavior id to be counted from selected units

examples.description: Count Medivh's Arcane Brilliance Ability from selected units
Count selected unit's permanent Invulnerable behavior

commands.description: Add an Effect to selected unit(s). Which are generally from `<CEffect*>`, such as `<CEffectSet id="xxxx">` or `<CEffectCreatePersistent id="xxx">`.

parameters.name: EffectId
parameters.description: Defines the effect id to be added to selected unit(s).

examples.description: Make the unit "suicide" a.k.a kill the unit
Make all selected units affect by Medivh's Polybomb

commands.description: Add an Effect to the center of the camera. Which are generally from `<CEffect*>`, such as `<CEffectSet id="xxxx">` or `<CEffectCreatePersistent id="xxx">`.

parameters.name: EffectId
parameters.description: Defines the effect id to be added to the center of the camera.

examples.description: Add some Haunted Mines Skulls to camera location
Add Haunted Mines's boss root animation to camera location

commands.description: Remove an Effect from selected unit(s). Which are generally from `<CEffect*>`, such as `<CEffectSet id="xxxx">` or `<CEffectCreatePersistent id="xxx">`.

parameters.name: EffectId
parameters.description: Defines the effect id to be removed from selected unit(s).

examples.description: No longer make selected unit(s) affect by Medivh's Polybomb
No longer make selected unit(s) affect by Medivh's Polybomb

commands.description: Remove an Effect from the center of the camera. Which are generally from `<CEffect*>`, such as `<CEffectSet id="xxxx">` or `<CEffectCreatePersistent id="xxx">`.

parameters.name: EffectId
parameters.description: Defines the effect id to be removed from the center of the camera.

examples.description: Remove Haunted Mines Skulls from camera location
Remove Haunted Mines's boss root animation from camera location

commands.description:
Play an Animation for selected unit(s).
>Note: There are Walk, Attack, A to Z animations etc

parameters.name: AnimationId
parameters.description: Defines the Animation ID to be played on selected unit(s)

examples.description: Play the Attack Animation for selected unit(s)
Play the Walk animation for selected unit(s)

commands.description:
Remove an Animation from selected unit(s).
>Note: There are Walk, Attack, A to Z animations etc

parameters.name: AnimationId
parameters.description: Defines the Animation ID to be removed from selected unit(s)

examples.description: Stop the Attack Animation for selected unit(s)
Stop the Walk animation for selected unit(s)

commands.description:
Send an Actor Message for selected unit(s). Generally from `<CActor*>`, the `<on send="xxx">`.
>Note: The command allows spaces for the parameter, since most actor messages have spaces.

parameters.name: ActorMessage
parameters.description: Defines the Actor Message to be sent. (This parameter allows spaces.)

examples.description: Play the A Spell animation, different on each hero
Hide the status bar, HP bar

commands.description: Gets the Ownership (Player ID) of selected unit(s).

examples.description: Gets the Ownership (Player ID) of selected unit(s).
Gets the Ownership (Player ID) of selected unit(s).

commands.description:
Changes ownership of the selected unit(s).
>Note: 0 is neutral, which cannot be selected once ownership have changed.

parameters.name: PlayerId
parameters.description: The new owner of the selected unit(s).

examples.description: Change all selected units's ownership to Player 1
Change all selected units's ownership to Player 6

commands.description: Constantly resetting the weapons (auto attack) cooldown, effectively increasing weapon speed.

examples.description: Constantly resetting the weapons (auto attack) cooldown
Constantly resetting the weapons (auto attack) cooldown

commands.description: Add a weapon to selected unit(s). Usually found in `<CWeapon* id='xxx'>`

parameters.name: WeaponID
parameters.description: The ID of the weapon

examples.description: Add Alexstrasza's Dragon Form weapon to selected unit(s)
Add Blaze's weapon to selected unit(s)

commands.description: Remove a weapon from selected unit(s). Usually found in `<CWeapon* id='xxx'>`

parameters.name: WeaponID
parameters.description: The ID of the weapon

examples.description: Remove Ana's weapon from selected unit(s)
Remove D.va mech mode's weapon from selected unit(s)

_metadata.libraryDescription: Commands that are related to Players, eg, scoreboard, respawn timer, etc

commands.description:
Toggle mass quest completion mode to give stack every game tick (0.0625s).
>Note: This is useful on heroes with actual infinite stacking such as Zuljin or Nazeebo. However due to Integeroverflow, after reached certain amount for the quest, the actual functionality will be overflowed, such as Nazeebo HP reduced to 1 if having max stacks with lv4 extra HP per stacltalent

parameters.name: stacks
parameters.description: The amount of stack to be added every game tick (0.0626s)

examples.description: Enable mass quest completion mode and give 10 stacks every game tick if not enabled
Disable mass quest completion mode if enabled

commands.description:
Set the Mastery Ring level. The ring below the hero will be automatically updated.
>Note: If the new Level is lower than the current one, you may need to respawn(e.g suicide) the selected units.

parameters.name: MasteryRingLevel
parameters.description: The level of the mastery ring to be set.

examples.description: Remove the mastery ring from the player
Set the mastery ring to Level 3.

commands.description: Toggle the display of the talents selection tree.

examples.description: Toggle the display of the talents selection tree.
Toggle the display of the talents selection tree.

commands.description: Toggle whether to pause the game when viewing talents, similar to heores tutorial.

examples.description: Toggle whether to pause the game when viewing talents
Toggle whether to pause the game when viewing talents

commands.description:
Remove a talent from a player, generally found in `<CTalent id="xxxx">`.
>Note: Some of the talents won't work, so you might want to experiment a bit.

parameters.name: TalentId
parameters.description: The talent id to be removed

parameters.name: PlayerId
parameters.description: The target player id to have the talent being removed.
parameters.defaultValue: The player id of whoever used this command.

examples.description: Removed Medivh's Arcane Explosion Talent from Player 1
Removed Malfurion's Celest>ial Alignment Talent from Player 2

commands.description:
Enable / Disable a talent for all player. Generally found in `<CTalent id="xxxx">`.
>Note: This only lock the selection of the talent. If the player already took the talent, it will not have any effect on the player.

parameters.name: TalentId
parameters.description: The talent id to be enabled/disabled.

parameters.name: isEnable
parameters.description: Set whether the talent should be enabled or disabled. (0 = disable, 1 = enable)

examples.description: Enable Rag's Lava Wave talent, which was disabled in ARAM.
Disable Maiev's Pursuit Of Vengeance talent

commands.description:
Override the current respawn timer for all players.
>Notice: Due to the system limitation, if you set to 0, it will change it to 0.0625 automatically (1 game tick).

parameters.name: seconds
parameters.description: The respawn time to be set for all players

examples.description: set the respawn timer to 99 seconds
set the respawn timer to 0.0625 second

commands.description:
Set the score for the scoreboard (some of them will shows in tab screen). This is good to use when some talents interact with scoreboard such as Zagara's Infest.
>Note: Though Infest internal function limits to `524%`, max of fixed value, but details are out of scope here.

You can obtain these FIELDs from `ScoreValueData.xml` in `heroesdata.stormmod`

>Note: Some fields uses Integer and some uses Fixed. However because this function is unified using `PlayerScoreValueSetFromInt()`, all decimals will be removed. As such, the max value for fixed is `524287` and `2147483647` for Integer. This limitation might change later.

parameters.name: Field
parameters.description: The field to be modified in the scoreboard.

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: The value to be set for the field in the scoreboard.

parameters.name: PlayerId
parameters.description: The player id for the modification to be applied.
parameters.defaultValue: The player id of whoever used this command.

examples.description: Set the field "Hero Damage" to 0 for the player who use this command.
Set the field "Kils" to 5242873 for the player who use this command
Set the field "Healing" to 1000 for the player 2

commands.description: Modify the respawn point for a player. Either at the current camera location or its default location.

parameters.name: Action
parameters.description: Choose the action of the comman. (set = set the respawn location at camera location, reset = reset all respawn location)

parameters.name: PlayerId/all
parameters.description: Set the player id for the spawn modification to take effect, use "all" for all players.
parameters.defaultValue: The player id of whoever used this command.

examples.description: set the respawn point for all players at the current camera location
set the respawn point to player who uses the command at the current camera location
set the respawn point for player 6 at camera location
reset player 2's respawn point to default location
reset all player's respawn point to its default respawn location (hall of storms).

commands.description:
Set the in-game overlay (e.g golden overlay for Uther's Divine Shield). 
>Note: The path is relative to `*.storm*/base.gamedata/`, usually with the extension of `*.stormcutscene`.

parameters.name: OverlayPath
parameters.description: The path of the overlay file, relative to base.stormdata.

examples.description: Set the overlay to "Invulnerable", e.g Divine Shield / Sanctification.
Set the overlay to Stitches Gorge.

commands.description: Remove all the overlays with the default one.

examples.description: Remove all the overlays with the default one.
Remove all the overlays with the default one.

_metadata.libraryDescription: A Builder Library that allows you to place objects anywhere in the map.
_metadata.overrideMarkdownContent:
**This system is still in a early development.**



Builder mode allows you to place objects to anywhere in the map. The units will constantly teleport to your cursor (follow your cursor). Remember to select `/ac` and `ts` in QA menu (this will added automatically in future development).



To use builder mode, select a unit, or units and press `backspace`. Builder mode will then be activated and you can place the units where you like.



To place the unit(s), press `backspace` again to deactivate builder mode.

_metadata.libraryDescription: A First Person Shooter like Library that allows you to see the map in first person camera.
_metadata.overrideMarkdownContent:
**This system is still in a early development.**



FPS Mode allows you to look at the map by using a first person camera on your unit. The camera will constantly look forward and turn as well as long as the mode is activated.



To toggle FPS mode, simply use the `fps` chat command.



### Controls:



 - `u` : Move your unit forward. (It will also clear queue commands and **Hold Position** after moved.)

 - ` (arrow key)` : Turn your unit and camera to left.

 - ` (arrow key)` : Turn your unit and camera to right.

 - ` (arrow key)` : Turn your camera upwards.

 - ` (arrow key)` : Turn your camera downwards.

_metadata.libraryDescription: Free Camera Mode allows you to change the angle of the camera easily.
_metadata.overrideMarkdownContent:
**This system is still in a early development.**

Free Camera Mode allows you to use `Middle Mouse Wheel` to freely change your camera angel and direction.

To enable or disable, simply use the chat command `tfc` or `togglefreecamera`!

>Note: Camera pan (move the camera by pushing mouse to the edge) will be disabled when free camera mode is active

_metadata.libraryDescription: Random useless stuff just for the lolz.
